intro: Monnina stipulata, commonly known as redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have stipules, which are small, leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalk. Monnina stipulata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
